answerText: residue[10] The residue of a function can be computed in this person's namesake integral formula. With Riemann, he names conditions that ensure complex differentiability, and with Schwarz, he names a generalization of the triangle inequality.
heading: STIMPY |2015 | Editors 3 | 12 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: This value is the coefficient a sub negative one of the Laurent series expansion of a function. For 10 points each: [10] For a meromorphic function f, this is the unique value R at an isolated singularity a such that f of z minus R over the quantity z minus a has an analytic antiderivative in a punctured disk about a.
